title: FF Isonorm
content:
Part of **[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typefaces) : Rounded Typefaces**

Current URL(s):  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_isonorm/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_isonorm/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_isonorm/")  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner\_flake/isonorm/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner_flake/isonorm/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner\_flake/isonorm/")

Designed by [Robert Kirchner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Robert%20Kirchner)

Even before [AutoCAD](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/typophile.com/wiki/AutoCAD) decided to acknowledge the existence of [PostScript](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/typophile.com/wiki/PostScript), artists and designers have been asking for a [PostScript](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016034020/http:/typophile.com/wiki/PostScript) version of the Isonorm draughtsman's face. A lot of creative people are eagerly waiting to misuse this geometrically-constructed standard letterform for their free-wheeling design. So now, at last, you can have some fun.
author: AndrewSipe
